dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, wait, they can't even tell us how much money Kazakhstani artists lost? That's, like, frankly, incredible.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, wait, they can't even tell us how much money Kazakhstani artists lost? That's, like, frankly, incredible.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, well, according to Vice Minister Kochetov, um, the system of payments just wasn't clear enough for them to quantify, you know, what was lost or what was being paid before.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, well, according to Vice Minister Kochetov, um, the system of payments just wasn't clear enough for them to quantify, you know, what was lost or what was being paid before.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Unfortunately, I cannot say how much money our artists lost, because this system of payments and rewards is not clear enough for us in terms of how it was before, what was paid.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wasn't clear enough? Are you serious?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: This isn't some backroom deal, this is Meta, one of the biggest platforms on the planet. And they just, like, genuinely don't know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: This isn't some backroom deal, this is Meta, one of the biggest platforms on the planet. And they just, like, genuinely don't know?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the article says it's, uh, a question of interaction between two economic entities, right? The author community and Meta.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the article says it's, uh, a question of interaction between two economic entities, right? The author community and Meta.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But first of all, this is the interaction of two economic entities. This is how our legislation is structured at the moment, where authors are represented by the author community, on the other hand, there is an online platform in the person of Meta, which puts forward its demands,

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: The Ministry of Culture, they say, plays a "maximum intermediary role."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The Ministry of Culture, they say, plays a maximum intermediary role.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Ministry of Culture, according to him, plays a "maximum intermediary role", but works to ensure that such things do not happen again.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Maximum intermediary role." Okay. So, they're just, like, holding hands between two giants who can't figure out how to, I don't know, sign a contract?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Maximum intermediary role. Okay. So, they're just, like, holding hands between two giants who can't figure out how to, I don't know, sign a contract?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: This has been since December, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: This has been since December, you know?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Last December, Kazakhs noticed that most of the songs by local artists had disappeared from Instagram, and their tracks could no longer be added to publications.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's right. Last December, um, most of the local artists' songs disappeared. The issue is a lack of agreements between Meta and a collective rights management organization.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's right. Last December, um, most of the local artists' songs disappeared. The issue is a lack of agreements between Meta and a collective rights management organization.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Last December, Kazakhs noticed that most of the songs by local artists had disappeared from Instagram... As Vice Minister of Justice Botagoz Zhakselekova explained, the reason is the lack of agreements between Meta and one of Kazakhstan's collective rights management organizations (CRMO).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, it's a rights management issue, but the Ministry of Culture is "at the forefront"? What exactly are they doing at the forefront if they can't even tell us the financial impact?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, it's a rights management issue, but the Ministry of Culture is at the forefront? What exactly are they doing at the forefront if they can't even tell us the financial impact?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: They're, uh, they've been there "from the very first days," according to Kochetov. Monitoring, communicating with artists, helping build a dialogue with Meta.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They're, uh, they've been there from the very first days, according to Kochetov. Monitoring, communicating with artists, helping build a dialogue with Meta.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As the official noted, the Ministry of Culture and Information has been "at the forefront of this problem" together with the Ministry of Justice from the very first days. (...) We are monitoring, we know what is happening, we communicate with artists. As far as this is possible from the point of view of our interaction with online platforms - with Meta, we, of course, help build a dialogue.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Helping build a dialogue." That sounds like, um, a very official way of saying "we sent an email."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Helping build a dialogue. That sounds like, um, a very official way of saying we sent an email.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: What about actually solving it? Like, are they getting their music back?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: What about actually solving it? Like, are they getting their music back?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, well, journalists asked about a timeframe. Kochetov said, "We ourselves are waiting very much." He's, like, refreshing his own Instagram pages, basically.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, well, journalists asked about a timeframe. Kochetov said, We ourselves are waiting very much. He's, like, refreshing his own Instagram pages, basically.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Journalists clarified: is there a time frame for when Kazakhstani music will return to Instagram? "We ourselves are waiting very much. I myself am sitting and constantly refreshing the pages on those posts on Instagram that were taken down because the music was blocked.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: He's refreshing his own pages? That's the official government response? That's just... that's not leadership.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He's refreshing his own pages? That's the official government response? That's just... that's not leadership.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's, like, a concerned user on the sidelines.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's, like, a concerned user on the sidelines.

dialogue_turns.text: He does say they "hope that in the near future" it will return, you know.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He does say they hope that in the near future it will return, you know.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We hope that in the near future (it will return - ed.)," the vice minister replied.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Hope." Right. And in the meantime, artists are just, what, still losing income that nobody can quantify. Like, that's just... I don't know.
